blockquote.p: St. Bernard Parish Government shall be a model of excellence in local government; a safe, well-planned community with equal opportunity for all.

In partnership with our community, the mission of St. Bernard Parish Government is to protect and enhance the quality of life by providing a high level of service in an efficient and responsive manner for all citizens.

div.class: inner col col24 first last id50cf19a3-b702-4699-8995-1fa4ca9bb503
inner col col24 first last id9108e5cc-e822-4f77-8e0f-811480abb9f8

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 24, 2020

div.div: President Trump has unveiled Guidelines for Opening Up America Again, a three-phased approach based on the advice of public health experts. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 23, 2020

div.div: Elections previously scheduled for June 20, 2020 and July 25, 2020 have been rescheduled for July 11, 2020 and August 15, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 21, 2020

div.div: All St. Bernard Parish Government employees will report to work on Monday, April 27, 2020 at their normal time. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 17, 2020

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Government wants residents and businesses to know that they can pay their water bills or apply for building permits online. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 16, 2020

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Animal Shelter is encouraging residents to have a plan in place for their beloved companion animals in the wake of COVID-19. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 15, 2020

div.div: As we are dealing with the COVID-19 crisis, our thoughts and prayers are with those who have lost love ones. Remember to follow the guidelines recommended by the Centers for Disease Control. Stay Safe! Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 14, 2020

div.div: Residents are reminded to complete to 2020 Census. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 13, 2020

div.div: The CDC recommends that we clean and disinfect frequently touched surfaces daily. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 8, 2020

div.div: To hear the latest video update from your parish officials visit www.facebook.com/StBGov or https://www.youtube.com/c/stbernardparishtelevision. Read on...

h4.a: Final CWPPRA vote for the 5th consecutive year

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Government is pleased to announce that another major coastal restoration project has advanced to the final statewide vote in the Coastal Wetlands Planning, Protection and Restoration Act (CWPPRA) program. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – April 6, 2020

div.div: Businesses should be following the Executive Order issued today by Parish President Guy McInnis to help combat the spread of COVID-19 within the Parish. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – March 30, 2020

div.div: St. Bernard Parish residents and businesses are reminded to Stay at Home and follow the recommendations of the Centers for Disease Control www.cdc.gov and the Louisiana Department of Health www.ldh.la.gov/coronavirus. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Video Update – March 27, 2020

div.div: Due to the Coronavirus Pandemic, St. Bernard Transit has made adjustments to its operation schedule. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – March 26, 2020

div.div: To Community Center of St. Bernard in Arabi is accepting new clients for food assistance. Please call (504) 518-5968 or visit www.ccofstb.com . Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Video Update – March 25, 2020

div.div: To help prevent the spread of COVID-19 residents and businesses should follow the guidelines set by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). To learn more visit www.cdc.gov. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Video Update – March 24, 2020

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Officials want to remind everyone to protect themselves and others by staying at home. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – March 24, 2020 Water and Sewer Office

div.div: The St. Bernard Parish Government Water & Sewer Office would like to inform residents of operating and procedures during the COVID-19 emergency. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Coronavirus Update – March 23, 2020

div.div: St. Bernard Parish leaders met today to discuss the Coronavirus and ways to prevent the spread in the parish. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish’s Response to the Coronavirus - Afternoon Update 3-20-20

div.div: The next update will be given on Monday, March 23rd. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish’s Response to the Coronavirus

div.div: Morning Update Friday, March 20, 2020 Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish’s Response to the Coronavirus - Afternoon Update 3/19/20

div.div: Here is the latest information on St. Bernard Parish’s response to the Coronavirus Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish’s Response to the Coronavirus Update 3/19/20 10:00 a.m. Chalmette, LA. – St. Ber

div.div: St. Bernard Parish local officials are in constant contact with state and federal officials and want you to have the most up-to-date information: Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Government Coronavirus (COVID-19) Update: 3/17/20

div.div:
St. Bernard Parish Hospital – Ochsner Health System
St. Bernard Parish Government today received updated information from the St. Bernard Parish Hospital—Ochsner Health. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Government Coronavirus (COVID-19) Update: 3/16/20

div.div: President McInnis Activates Essential Personnel Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Government Coronavirus (COVID-19) Update: March 13, 2020 Updates

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Government continues to monitor the Coronavirus (COVID-19) with local and state partners, Parish Government has taken the strategic step to suspend Parish related events of 250 people or more as directed by Governor John Bel Edwards. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Government Postpone Meetings and Events

div.div: In light of the current Coronavirus situation, St. Bernard Parish Government announces the following changes to previously scheduled events and meetings. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish (COVID-19) Coronavirus Update

div.div: When it comes to coronavirus, the message in St. Bernard Parish is the same: wash your hands, observe CDC protocols and, if you get sick, stay home and contact your doctor. Read on...

h4.a: Wind Down Wednesdays FREE Concert Series Kicks off Wednesday, March 11th

div.div: Short Circuit Band will kick off the 2020 “Wind-Down Wednesday” Concert Series on Wednesday, March 11, 2020 at 6:00 p.m. Read on...

h4.a: Bayou Terre aux Boeufs Ridge Armoring Project

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Government Officials were at the site of the Bayou Terre aux Boeufs Ridge Armoring Project in Delacroix, Louisiana. Read on...

h4.a: Dravo Wastewater Treatment Plant Demolition and Site Improvement Project

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Government Officials were on hand for the Dravo Wastewater Treatment Plant Demolition and Site Improvement Project at the intersection of Hermitage and Jean Lafitte Parkway in Chalmette. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Government Water & Sewer Division wins National EPA Award

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Government Water and Sewer Division was awarded the 2019 Aquarius Award by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency for their Waterline Replacement Project. Read on...

h4.a: Solid Waste Removal Update for St. Bernard Parish

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Government officials have announced the selection of IV Waste to manage the Parish’s curbside garbage collection and waste removal. Read on...

h4.a: Paperless Water Bill Update

div.div: St. Bernard Parish Government would like to inform residents that paperless water billing is now operating. Read on...

h4.a: St. Bernard Parish Special Medical Needs Residents are Eligible for Assistance

div.div: Are you a St. Bernard Parish resident with special medical needs that require evacuation assistance during Hurricane Season? Read on...

h4.a: Meraux Foundation Recognized with the 2020 Friend of Tourism Award

div.div: The St. Bernard Parish Tourism Commission recognized the Arlene and Joseph Meraux Charitable Foundation with the 2020 Friend of Tourism Award for the outstanding contributions the Meraux Foundation has made to supporting tourism over many years. Read on...

h4.a: Parish Officials Sworn Into Office for the 2020-2024 Term

div.div: St. Bernard Parish President Guy McInnis and the St. Bernard Parish Council were officially sworn into office.
/CivicAlerts.aspx

div.class: inner col col24 first last id52216f35-8214-4996-97a8-7fd82e8f211b

div.h3: Town Hall Meeting - Southeast Louisiana Flood Protection Authority
div.p: St. Bernard Parish President Guy McInnis hosted a Town Hall Meeting to discuss the future of Southeast Louisiana Flood Protection Authority-East (SLFPA) in our community.
St. Bernard Parish along with Louisiana Sea Grant hosted their second seafood market at the Delacroix Fishing Complex with the goal of connecting the public with the local fishing community.

div.h3: Get to know your Parish President
div.p: Get an intimate look at Parish President Guy McInnis as he shares how he got his start in politics, his goals for the future of St. Bernard and life at home with his family. Now airing on Cox Channel 76, U-verse channel 99 and the St. Bernard YouTube channel.
Your elected officials and representatives are looking out for you as they fight for your flood protection in St. Bernard Parish.
All these video and more can be found on the St. Bernard Television YouTube channel.

h4.a: Homeland Security & Emergency Preparedness

div.div: The Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Preparedness is responsible for keeping St. Bernard Parish families informed by providing up-to-date information on homeland security and emergency operations. Read More
/CivicAlerts.aspx
